readability_reflection: String concatenation was the only one that made sense to me. I have never learned string interpolation.
comprehension_debugging: String concatenation is easier for me to read because it's the only one I have experience with. Seeing quotations like "Hello" + "World", I automatically think that that is concatenation. The squiggly brackets on the other hand {} was all new to me in terms of manipulating strings.
preference_rationale: I'm choosing string concatenation simply because it's the only one I'm familiar with. This is the first time I'm looking at snippets of interpolation.
learning_curve: As mentioned before, whenever I see quotations, I automatically think it is string concatenation. I am not that familiar with using the brackets {} to utilize interpolation.
suggestions_improvement: I don't have suggestions on the syntax itself but syntax highlighting is what helps me a lot when reading and understanding code in an efficient manner.
